question:
Gabriel is planting a lemon tree. The tree will cost $126 to plant. 
    Each year it will grow 8 lemons, which he can sell for $1.5 each. 
    It costs $5 a year to water and feed the tree. 
    How many years will it take before he starts earning money on the lemon tree?
answer:
He makes $12.0 selling lemons each year because 8 x 1.5 = <<8*1.5=12.0>>12.0.
    He earns $7.0 each year from the lemon tree because 12.0 - 5 = <<12.0-5=7.0>>7.0.
    It will take 18 years to earn enough to pay off the tree because 126 / 7.0 = <<126/7.0=18>>18.
    He will make money in year 19 because 18 + 1 = <<18+1=19>>19.
    #### 19

    Each year it will grow 13 lemons, which he can sell for $0.5 each. 
    It costs $6 a year to water and feed the tree. 
    How many years will it take before he starts earning money on the lemon tree?
answer:
He makes $6.5 selling lemons each year because 13 x 0.5 = <<13*0.5=6.5>>6.5.
    He earns $0.5 each year from the lemon tree because 6.5 - 6 = <<6.5-6=0.5>>0.5.
    It will take 294 years to earn enough to pay off the tree because 147 / 0.5 = <<147/0.5=294>>294.
    He will make money in year 295 because 294 + 1 = <<294+1=295>>295.
    #### 295
